meanings.definition: Causing great and irreparable harm or damage.
meanings.sent1: The tornado was very destructive, destroying many homes in its path.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire's destructive force left a trail of devastation in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The destructive power of the toddler's tantrum was surprisingly intense.
meanings.sent4: The destructive impact of the earthquake was felt for miles around.
meanings.sent5: The destructive nature of the storm was evident in the fallen trees and debris.

meanings.sent1: Leaving a trail of destruction behind, the hurricane was truly destructive.
meanings.sent2: The use of harsh chemicals can be very destructive to the environment.
meanings.sent3: The destructive tendencies of the puppy led to a chewed-up shoe collection.
meanings.sent4: The destructive behavior of the vandals left the town in disarray.
meanings.sent5: The destructive impact of the flood was evident in the flooded streets and damaged buildings.

meanings.sent1: The explosive device was highly destructive, capable of leveling entire buildings.
meanings.sent2: The invasive species proved to be highly destructive to the local ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The destructive potential of the new weapon was a cause for concern among the military.
meanings.sent4: The destructive force of the volcano could be seen in the lava flowing down its slopes.
meanings.sent5: The destructive power of the storm surge was evident in the flooded coastal areas.
